market_analysis.title: ESS Battery: Strong momentum and positive outlook; November shipment review
market_analysis.section:
, ~70-80% of total shipment coming from overseas 
in 11M25 (vs ~65% in 2024), which can provide better profitability owing to higher requirement on product 
quality, and better competition landscape. Compared to BYD and other tier-2 players, CATL has much higher 
exposure in the US market. 
â€¢
Tier 2 players: ~60-70% of Rept and EVEâ€™s total shipment came from the overseas market in 11M25, of which 
~38% were from RoW. In comparison, Gotion and CALBâ€™s ~45-55% shipments came from China domestic 
market in 11M25. 
Battery playersâ€™ market share in each region in 11M25:
â€¢
Globally, CATL is ranked top 1, followed by Hithium, EVE and BYD. 
â€¢
China domestic market has experienced fierce competition with lowest market concentration ratio, when 
comparing with US, EU and other regions. In China domestic market, CATL has only ~15% market share (down 
from 25% in 2024). We expect CATL to gain shares in the domestic market in the long term post the ESS policy 
changes along with Doc 136. 
â€¢
US market: CATL has the leading position and accounted for ~48% market share, followed by Hithium and 
EVE 
â€¢
EU market: CATL has ~20% market share in EU, followed by EVE, Rept and Hithium.
â€¢
RoW: CATL and BYD has >20% market share, followed by EVE, CALB and Rept.
By end-application:
â€¢
Utility-scale ESS battery market: China accounted for 39% share in this segment (vs ~50% in 2024). Battery 
playersâ€™ shipments and market share breakdown by region in utility-scale ESS battery market were similar to the 
overall market.
â€¢
Residential ESS battery market: EU accounted for 71% share in this segment, while Chinaâ€™s residential ESS 
battery market size was nearly zero. By player, Rept, EVE and Great Power are the top 3 players and collectively 
accounted for ~54% market share in the EU, the US and other regions, followed by BYD.

Legal Proceedings.From time to time, various legal and regulatory claims and proceedings are pending or threatened against the Company and its subsidiaries. While the amounts claimed may be substantial, the Company is unable to predict with certainty the ultimate outcome of such claims and proceedings. The Company establishes reserves whenever it believes it to be appropriate for pending litigation matters. However, the actual results of resolving the pending litigation matters may be substantially higher than the amounts reserved.If one or more matters were decided against us, the effects could be material to our results of operations in the period in which we would be required to record or adjust the related liability and could also be material to our cash flows in the periods that we would be required to pay such liability.
